Hey Curran -- my gut hunch is either Nakane Heihachiro or Edo Higo, 
most p=
rob Nakane.  The example on Andy Quirts site and this one have 
the same in=
dentations about the nakagoana (I am not certain if tagane 
mei is appropri=
ate here -- Jim would know on this -- I've seen this on 
other Higo pieces =
also).  You know I've seen examples from some of the 
other Higo schools wi=
th this 'look' so it's sort of a guess.  

From what I've heard the Higo Ta=
ikan has a lot of questionable 
attributions, but then it seems as time goe=
s on that's what you here 
about most of the older reference books.  I get =
the feeling there is a 
move into orthodoxy going on in the field -- Sasano=
, Torigoye, and 
other explorationists being questioned in absentia.  Hmmmm=
, always 
interesting.  I have to wonder at times if not being able to read=
 the 
Japanese texts is a curse or a blessing in disguise as it forces us t=
o 
think for ourselves (heretics all) instead of towing the party line.
Wel=
l, I guess I've still got that 60's in me!  Later.
